page.title: 16Dudleston Hall (continued)
page.content: Her{2 sons}live in the other{2 houses. One of them is a{farm cottage,}built in{1963,}and the other is a{16th centuary farm house. The house the owner lives in is the largest of the 3, and was built in{1822.}They have lived there since{1959. There are{4 men}working on the farm, including the{2 sons. One}of the employed men does mainly milking and the other does odd jobs. They rent some land in{North Wales where they keep{sheep.}This is not unusual in this area. It is about{70 {miles}away from where they live. They are not very cut off where they live but it is a bit lonely if you like a lot of people. They do not get out much, partly because they do not want to and partly because they are too busy. {By Nerys Webster { Gareth Hampson
